poem:
**The Missing Tooth Fairy**  

In the land of molars and bicuspids,  
where smiles fade to phantoms,  
the queue bends unaware of its tail.  

Each mouth, a cavern echoing  
with hollow promises, while pliers  
and silver cards groan.  

The tooth fairy's flight is thwarted,  
broken-winged by neglect, and DIY dreams.  
Gums bleed in the biting cold.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Plan to increase access to NHS dentists in England ‘a complete failure’, MPs say The official plan to increase access to NHS dental services in England has been a “complete failure”, and some of the government’s initiatives have worsened the crisis, a damning report warns. Millions of patients continue to be denied dental care, forcing them to pay for private treatment, build up mountains of credit card debt, or even worse perform dangerous DIY dentistry". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Plan to increase access to NHS dentists in England ‘a complete failure’, MPs say The official plan to increase access to NHS dental services in England has been a “complete failure”, and some of the government’s initiatives have worsened the crisis, a damning report warns. Millions of patients continue to be denied dental care, forcing them to pay for private treatment, build up mountains of credit card debt, or even worse perform dangerous DIY dentistry
